title: Indonesian Rendang Beef Curry
directions: With the rump steak, trim off fat and dice a into chunky pieces.
Place a thick bottomed pot (cast iron) on high heat.
Add the whole jar of Rendang curry sauce (or 1 ½ cups of home made).
Add the meat pieces and mix well.
Add 1 ½ cups of water, mix and cover with lid. Turn heat to the lowest setting and cook for 2 ½ hours.
Wash the rice using a sieve under cold running water, until cloudy water becomes clear.
Add 1 ½ cups of water to rice and turn the heat to full.
Season with salt and pepper, mix well.
Once water starts to boil, cover saucepan with a lid, turn heat down to very very low and set a timer for 11-12 minutes.
Remove lid and fluff up rice using a fork. Keep aside with lid back on.
Place a frying pan on moderate heat, add the coconut and toast dry until brown in colour.
Add the coconut to the meat 2 hours into cooking time, stir well. Leave to cook 30 more minutes.
When sauce appears to have almost evaporated, it’s time to serve (do not burn).
Serve with rice and garnish with a julienne of chili and baby kaffir lime leaf (this step is optional).
ingredients: 1½ cups of WorldFoods Rendang curry sauce (or click here for recipe)
Optional chili and baby kaffir lime for garnish
